comments.body:
This can be noarch as it doesn't have any native code.
```suggestion
  number: 0
  noarch: python
```

Hello

Thanks for your feedback.
I don't support windows and I am not willing to. This is the reason why I put the build selector. The point with this approach is that it forbids me to have noarch packages.

Building packages separate for all Python version even if it isn't needed wastes CI resources and introduces a maintenance burden. Feel free to close issues in the package issue tracker about this but I don't think we should put this burden artifically on the conda-forge shoulders.
@xhochy I understand your point. I'll see what I can do to make it pass. Thanks for your review.
